column4: EasyTAG 1.99.11 - How do I edit the genre field of 2367 files recursively to add "library_item"?
you want sed
assuming it's not a binary package
s/package/format/
sed? on apt?
depends on what you want to do
if the files are in text format (or you can transform them to text format), and you have a string you want to change, sed is the best way to do it
we could all just type "/ignore..." ;)
oh, I was talking about several audio formats, sorry forgot to mention :)
not really sure how you'd do that
is there a program/command you run to edit the file?
e.g. can you do "edit_the_tag_of 1file"
EasyTAG 1.99.11 is what i have
is that command line? GUI?
gui
and what sort of file is it editing? mp3?
(e.g. changing ID3 tags)
i guess all sorts of files with tags (id3, flac vorbis tag etc)
hmmm... unless it takes command-line options (e.g. something like easytag file --cli --change-tag <tagname> <tovalue>), you'll need to use another program
something like id3ed, for instance
you can then pass file names to it using wildcards or xargs
good idea, i'll probably mess it up but worth trying, thanks :)
